info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 12:22PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Sullivan and northeastern Pike Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shohola, or 11 miles northwest of Montague, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lackawaxen, Shohola, Greeley, Highland Lake, Millrift, Eldred, Glen Spey, Twin Lakes and Barryville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
